Eckerd’s waterfront campus sits on the Gulf peninsula of Florida’s west coast. Students live in one of nine traditional and two apartment-style residence halls, some with views of the water. We even have
editor Loren Pope sifted through thousands of U.S. colleges and universities to pick just 40.

Join us this spring to experience Eckerd life.
Congratulations on your acceptance to Eckerd College! Now that you’ve been accepted to the College, come explore your future…

It is necessary to register online for this event. Space is limited, so please register as soon as you are able. We ask that students please register for one event only (please note, the $50 registration fee is nonrefundable).
Visiting admitted students register for the weekend and receive schedule information. While you wait you can pick up some snacks on the patio or purchase lunch at Triton’s Pub (cash only).

Come learn about the many programs offered at Eckerd’s own waterfront and take a ride on beautiful Boca Ciega Bay. All registrants will receive an invitation to sign-up for a boat ride three weeks prior to the event date. Sunday boat rides are reserved for students
. Monday boat rides are available to students and families.
Welcome Program – Your First Year at Eckerd College
Join Professor Margie Sanfilippo to find out more about the Autumn Term, Faculty Mentoring Program and unique first-year programs offered at Eckerd.
A current student will lead a tour of campus for admitted students and their families. Tours are optional and will leave periodically.

After your campus tour, we have a feeling you might want a snack to hold you over until dinner. Join us outside of Miller Auditorium for something to munch on before your Q&A panel. We will do our best to accommodate those with dietary restrictions.
Current students will field questions on what it is like to be an Eckerd student. This is a chance to get to know some of our students in a fun and casual setting.
Current students and parents will field questions on what it is like to be an Eckerd student. This is a chance to get to know some of our students and parents in a fun and casual setting.
Join us in Fox Hall for dinner where you can meet current students, other admitted students and their families.
7:00 – 8:30 p.m. | NIELSEN CENTER FOR VISUAL ARTS
Parents are invited to join current Eckerd parents and faculty who will be available to answer questions about the Eckerd experience.
Join our current students for a bonfire, s’mores, music and other activities at the waterfront.

Students can enjoy breakfast in Café Bon Appétit’s main dining hall. Remember to wear your name tag – this serves as your meal ticket! Make sure you give yourself enough time to find your classroom at 9:30 a.m.
Parents are invited to join President Eastman, members of the Executive Staff, and Student Affairs for a special presentation and casual discussion over breakfast.
9:30 – 10:30 a.m. | CONSULT INSIDE LABEL FOR CLASSROOM LOCATION

Each student will have an opportunity to experience academics at Eckerd. Students, please arrive early to your class and introduce yourself to the professor. He or she will be expecting you. Consult individual student schedule for the location of your class.

Join Dr. Pat Watkins, Director of Financial Aid, and Angie Noronow, College Bursar, for a general overview of the billing, scholarship and financial aid processes. You may also stop by the Financial Aid Office until 5:00 p.m. with your questions.
Come learn about the many programs offered at Eckerd’s own waterfront and take a ride on beautiful Boca Ciega Bay. Sign up for one of these boat rides in advance at check-in or dinner.
Information Fair featuring Academic Programs, Student Organizations and Academic Services

Meet with faculty members from all 40 areas of study to discuss academic opportunities. Learn about a variety of Eckerd’s student-run clubs and organizations. Representatives from financial aid, international education, counseling and health services, and service learning will be available to discuss various opportunities.
Join Eckerd College faculty for our final meal together.
(Optional) Mini Tour of the Nielsen Center for Visual Arts
Students interested in the visual arts will take a more in-depth tour of the Nielsen Center for Visual Arts.
(Optional) Mini Tour of Galbraith Marine Science Center
Students interested in Marine Science will take a more in-depth tour of the Galbraith Marine Science Laboratory.
(Optional) Mini Tour of James Center Laboratories
Students interested in taking a more in-depth tour of our laboratories inside of James Center will be led by a natural science faculty member.
(Optional) Mini Tour of Sigma Housing Complex
Students interested in viewing a residential space in the Sigma Complex will be led by a Student Ambassador.
Check out our viewbook for an in-depth look at Eckerd.
See how Eckerd students succeed with employers and grad schools.
